inventory.commentary: 28nov06 update wn2.1, changed definitions, changed/added examples added features. ahouston

sense.name: the act of transmitting electromagnetic signals across distances
sense.commentary: TELECOMMUNICATION[+event][+communication][+transmission][+remote][+signal][+electromagnetic] Note: refers to events of actually sending signals (or potentially sending them)
sense.examples: The telecommunication of these messages occurs at the speed of light. The attack was intended to disrupt their telecommunication capabilities. The encryption provided secure telecommunications between the military bases.

sense.name: the science and technology of signal transmission
sense.commentary: TELECOMMUNICATION[+entity][+symbolic][+knowledge][+domain][+technology][+transmission][+remote][+signal][+electromagnetic] (often plural) the branch of electrical engineering concerned with the technology of electronic communication at a distance Note: refers to the know-how required to do Sense 1
sense.examples: He worked in the telecommunications industry for many years. Sally is taking an advanced course in telecommunications. Their company pioneered many of the recent advances in telecommunications.
